isis.stitle: EC-17 ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROLLER - ANTILOCK AND TRACTION WIRING GENERAL NOTES

svcproc.title: ANTILOCK AND TRACTION WIRING GENERAL NOTES
svcproc.para: The wires that carry information and power into and out of the EC-17 are generally grouped and terminate at a connector. The wire groups or wire harnesses along with the connectors are most often specified and/or supplied by the vehicle manufacturer. Refer to Figure 4 for the connectors used on the EC-17. The wiring harnesses and connectors are weather resistant and the wires that enter the connector are sealed to the connector. The wire gauge used in the wire harnesses is specific to the task performed.
When diagnosing wiring in the antilock system, the following general rules apply and should be followed where applicable:

step1.para: It is generally advisable to replace a wire harness rather than repair individual wires in the harness. If a splice repair must be made, it is important that the splice be properly soldered with a water based or thoroughly cleaned rosin flux (not acid based) and made waterproof.
Do not pierce wire insulation when checking for continuity. Check for power, ground or continuity by disconnecting the connector and testing the individual pins or sockets in the connector.
Do not spread or enlarge individual pins or sockets during probing.

Always check the vehicle handbook for wire and connector identification. Individual wire identification will differ depending upon the type of connectors in use, the vehicle manufacturer, and the system features in use.
While the retarder disable, serial link, and traction on/off connections are present on all EC-17 controllers, they are not always used.
